dataset.title: Bonanza Creek LTER Study Sites, Roads, and other Locations: GIS/Spatial Data

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Biology and Wildlife; Institute of Arctic Biology: University of Alaska Fairbanks 193 Arctic Health P.O. Box 757000
Boreal Ecology Cooperative Research Unit University of Alaska Fairbanks School of Agriculture and Land Resources Management P.O. Box 756780

abstract.para:
The list of study sites, meteorological stations and locations of interest that are shown on the Bonanza Creek Long Term Ecological Research site (BNZ LTER) internet map server (IMS, available at http://www.lter.uaf.edu/ims_intro.cfm) is generated from the LTER study sites database. The information is converted into a shapefile and posted to the IMS. Some study sites shown on the main LTER website will not appear on the IMS because they do not have location coordinates. In all cases the most up-to-date information will be found on the (study sites website ).
The spatial information represented on the IMS is available to the public according to the restrictions outlined in the LTER data policy. The dataset represented here consists of the map layers shown on the IMS. The information consists of shapefiles in Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) format. Users of this dataset should be aware that the contents are dynamic. Portions of the information shown on the IMS are derived from the Bonanza Creek LTER databank and are constantly being updated.

section.title: Access to Data
section.para: While metadata will be freely available to those requesting it, the data manager will assure that any restrictions on access to data sets in the database will be enforced. Data will not be released without proper permission first being obtained from the investigator who generated the data.

section.title: Use of data
section.para: Researchers should receive adequate acknowledgment for the use of their data by others and should be provided with copies of publications using their data. Users of data from the data base must be aware that data is not to be sold or redistributed.

section.title: Citing Bonanza Creek LTER Datasets
section.para: It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists. Thus, the Data User will properly cite the Data Set in any publications or in the metadata of any derived data products that were produced using the Data Set.

section.title: Methods
section.para: Study sites-Many Bonanza Creek LTER study sites, meteorological stations and other locations of interest are located using Global Positioning System technology. Some sites locations may be estimated from topographical maps. Some indications of the accuracy of the coordinates should be available in the appropriate shapefile. Information about LTER study sites shown on the internet map server are also available at the LTER databank (Study sites). Roads and trails-Locations of roads and trails were determined through travel with a global positioning system. The resulting arcs were converted to shapefiles. At present there has been no refinement of the road and trail locations. Close examination of the lines may reveal loops or waviness due to obstacles encountered on the ground.

otherEntity.entityDescription: GIS DATA: Study sites, meteorological stations and locations of interest associated with the Bonanza Creek Long Term Ecological Research site.
